RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
The Hillshire Brands Company 
Storm Lake, Iowa

Background Data

In accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Chapter 68 (40 CFR 68) promulgated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), The Hillshire Brands Company, a Wholly owned subsidiary of Tyson Foods, Inc. submits this Risk Management Plan (RMP) for operations located at the 315 Vilas Road in Storm Lake, Iowa.  The Hillshire Brands Company operations include slaughtering, de-boning, and some processing. The Hillshire Brands Company has been in operation at this facility for over 50 years providing quality meat products and 740 jobs to the local community.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy

The Hillshire Brands Company is committed to protecting the health of its employees, the surrounding community, and the environment. It is The Hillshire Brands Company policy to maintain a safe and healthy workplace, protect the environment, and comply with all applicable regulations, including 40 CFR 68, as applicable. Accidental releases are kept small or eliminated and emergency response readiness is maintained through the processes implemented per requirements of these regulations.

Stationary Sources and Regulated Substances

The Hillshire Brands Company is required to maintain low temperatures in the food processing areas of the plant that are within standards required by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) to ensure quality in the final products. The Hillshire Brands Company also operates freezers and coolers for product storage.  The Hillshire Brands Company uses anhydrous anhydrous ammonia (the 112(r) regulated substance) as a refrigerant to maintain the facility within the required range of operating temperatures and to operate the freezers and coolers. Anhydrous ammonia is an industry-standard refrigerant for meat processing plants. The Hillshire Brands Company's refrigeration system, consisting o

f receivers, compressors, evaporators, condensers, and piping, contains over 10,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia. 

Accidental Release Prevention Program

To prevent and mitigate accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia, The Hillshire Brands Company has implemented certain precautionary measures, including process / equipment controls, procedures, preventative maintenance programs, employee training and auditing.  In addition, The Hillshire Brands Company's ammonia refrigeration system is designed and constructed in accordance with accepted industry standards and good engineering practices. 

The Hillshire Brands Company has also developed and implemented a Process Safety Management (PSM) program pursuant to Occupational Health and Safety Agency (OSHA) regulations and as such, has evaluated the system for the potential of anhydrous ammonia releases. Some of the controls installed to prevent catastrophic releases of ammonia are process equipment (pressure relief valves, backup pumps, and manual shutoffs) and automated controls (automatic level controls and automatic process shutdown).  In addition, Hillshire Brands has trained approximately 20 personnel to respond to potential ammonia releases (HAZMAT team).

The Hillshire Brands Company has developed standard operating procedures for all employees and contractors that have contact with the ammonia refrigeration system that incorporate safety measures into the procedures.  These safety procedures were developed by refrigeration system operators and are reviewed on an annual basis.  The Hillshire Brands Company encourages employee participation in development of the control measures used at the plant by means of company safety meetings, employee participation meetings, training sessions and postings on bulletin bulls.  Pursuant to written management of change procedures established by The Hillshire Brands Company, any changes to the operating procedures are to be communicated to affected employees.

The Hills

hire Brands Company understands that maintaining the refrigeration system in good working order is essential to preventing accidental releases; therefore Hillshire Brands has implemented a preventative maintenance program.  The preventative maintenance program is scheduled, documented and managed using a computer maintenance management software system to ensure that regular maintenance occurs on the system, while ensuring the mechanical integrity of critical refrigeration system components.

To ensure that The Hillshire Brands Company's control measures are effective in maintaining the safe operation of the plant, regularly scheduled audits are performed on the ammonia refrigeration system.  In accordance with the PSM program, an independent source conducts a detailed PSM compliance audit at least every three years. It incorporates a review of process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, training programs, system mechanical integrity, management of change, pre-start up review procedures, compliance audit procedures, incident investigation procedures, employee participation programs, hot work permit procedures, and contractor safety procedures.

Five-Year Accident History

Over the last five years, The Hillshire Brands Company has not experienced an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia causing any on-site death, injury or significant property damage, or known off-site death, injury, property damage, environmental damage, off site evacuations or sheltering in place.

Emergency Response Program

The Hillshire Brands Company has documented emergency response procedures in a document entitled EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of an off-site anhydrous ammonia release.  Included in the plan are measures to be taken internally by The Hillshire Brands Company personnel who are trained in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, OSHA's Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulatio

ns according to their duties and function.  These personnel receive initial training and annual refresher training thereafter.  As an additional training exercise, a simulation of an emergency release is conducted on an annual basis. 

To assure that the local governmental response agencies are familiar with The Hillshire Brands Company emergency response procedures, The Hillshire Brands Company has submitted copies of the plan for review by the local agencies.  The following local agencies have reviewed The Hillshire Brands Company plan:

Emergency Management Coordinator

Fire Department

To plan for an ammonia release with off-site effects, The Hillshire Brands Company's plan includes procedures/equipment to mitigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, transportation maps for response agencies, evacuation route maps, and procedures for public communication.

In the event of an anhydrous ammonia release with off-site effects, the general public will be warned using the following methods:

Sirens

Broadcast message via the local cable television system

Police and fire vehicles equipped with public address systems, and

Door-to-door notification of residents (if deemed necessary).

As backup measures, Hillshire Brands has arranged emergency response assistance with a clean-up contractor.

Continuing Efforts to Improve Safety

As part of Hillshire Brands' continuous efforts to improve the safety of the system, changes are planned at the facility to improve safety and prevent anhydrous ammonia releases. These changes include improvements to operating procedures, increased protection of ammonia equipment, and increased ammonia safety training.
